intro: Thelypodium tularense, commonly known as the tularean thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, yellow to brown flowers in the summer. Thelypodium tularense is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
